Noun: a certificate of debt (usually interest-bearing or discounte)
a connection based on kinship or marriage or common interest
a restraint that confines or restricts freedom (especially something used to tie down or restrain a prisone)
a connection that fastens things together
a superior quality of strong durable white writing paper; originally made for printing documents
United States civil rights leader who was elected to the legislature in Georgia but was barred from taking his seat because he opposed the Vietnam War (born 194)
British secret operative 007 in novels by Ian Fleming
the property of sticking together (as of glue and woo)
Verb: bring together in a common cause or emotion
